titles.title: John Muir National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act
John Muir National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act
John Muir National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act
John Muir National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act
John Muir National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act
To adjust the boundary of the John Muir National Historic Site, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 108-555.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 323.

action.text: Mr. Gibbons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3706.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici without amendment. With written report No. 108-378.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 737.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 10/30/2004--Public Law. John Muir National Historic Site Boundary Adjustment Act - Adjusts the boundary of the John Muir National Historic Site to include specified lands and authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire those lands and interests in such lands. Requires such lands and interests to be administered as part of the Site.
